# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:01:53
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  + 
 + Do you understand the rules? +

## TIME: 11:02:05
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:02:05].
The other players in the game are:
 Adrian ( bystander ) 
 Sidney ( mafia ) 
 Parker ( bystander ) 
 Drew ( bystander ) 
 Tyler ( bystander ) 
 Kennedy ( bystander ) 
The other players that have not been eliminated (lynched or killed) yet are:
Adrian ( bystander ) 
Sidney ( mafia ) 
Parker ( bystander ) 
Drew ( bystander ) 
Tyler ( bystander ) 
Kennedy ( bystander ) 
In your response to that is shown to the user (excluding your hidden scratchpad), you can ONLY respond with one of two possible outputs:
<wait> - indicating your character in the game should wait and not send a message in the current timing;
<send> - indicating your character in the game should send a message to the public chat now.

You must NEVER output any other text, explanations, or variations of these tokens. Only these exact tokens are allowed: <wait> or <send>.
 + 
 + The current time is [11:02:05].
No player has sent a message yet.
Do you want to send a message to the group chat now, or do you prefer to wait for now and see what messages others will send? Remember to choose to send a message only if your contribution to the discussion in the current time will be meaningful enough. Make sure to say something every once in a while, and make yourself heard. Remember you like to be active in the game, so participate and be as talkative as other players! Reply only with `<send>` if you want to send a message now, or only with `<wait>` if you want to wait for now, based on your decision!
Don't add the time, the timestamp or the [timestamp] in your answer!
 +

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:02:05].
The other players in the game are:

## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

[11:02:41] Parker: hey everyone—i was quiet because i was reading through everyone’s intros, not because i’m hiding something. finley and adrian both flagged my silence, but honestly none of us had anything solid to go on until now. finley, adrian—what about my being quiet strikes you more mafia than just a cautious bystander?

also, i noticed drew said they’d be “lurking on early votes.” smart bystander move, or a mafia wanting to avoid the spotlight? since we need to get the ball rolling, maybe we start with someone who was eager to point fingers—adrian, you jumped right on me. thoughts on kicking off with adrian? or does anyone else feel someone else deserves our first look?

## TIME: 11:03:08
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:02:05].
The other players in the game are:
 Adrian ( bystander ) 
 Sidney ( mafia ) 
 Parker ( bystander ) 
 Drew ( bystander ) 
 Tyler ( bystander ) 
 Kennedy ( bystander ) 
The other players that have not been eliminated (lynched or killed) yet are:
Adrian ( bystander ) 
Sidney ( mafia ) 
Parker ( bystander ) 
Drew ( bystander ) 
Tyler ( bystander ) 
Kennedy ( bystander ) 
In your response to that is shown to the user (excluding your hidden scratchpad), you can ONLY respond with one of two possible outputs:
<wait> - indicating your character in the game should wait and not send a message in the current timing;
<send> - indicating your character in the game should send a message to the public chat now.

You must NEVER output any other text, explanations, or variations of these tokens. Only these exact tokens are allowed: <wait> or <send>.

[11:02:17] Drew: hey everyone, drew here! quiet start on day 1—hard to pull any reads with no chatter yet. what are your initial gut feelings? i’ll be lurking on how everyone votes early on, but i’d love to hear any first impressions
[11:02:21] Tyler: hey everyone, tyler here! super excited to get started. day 1 and we don’t have much to go on yet, so let’s share our gut instincts—anyone already feeling dodgy about someone? i’ll hang back and listen, but i’m eager to hear your first impressions before we cast any votes
[11:02:23] Finley: hey everyone, finley here! excited to get started. since it’s day 1 and we’ve got zero info, how about we each share our first impression or any gut feeling? i’ll kick things off: i don’t have a strong read yet, but parker’s been awfully quiet so far—could be nothing. what about the rest of you
[11:02:24] Sidney: hey everyone! excited to get started. no one’s spoken yet, which makes it tough to pick a suspect, but often the first person who jumps in might be trying to steer the conversation—or total silence could be just as telling. what do you all think? any early gut feelings
[11:02:25] Parker: hey everyone, parker here—excited to get started! since it’s day 1 we don’t have any hard clues yet, so i’ll be listening more than leading off with wild accusations. but i do tend to notice patterns—who’s too quiet, who’s overly eager to point fingers. what are your gut feelings so far? any initial strategy ideas before we dive in
[11:02:29] Kennedy: hey everyone! kennedy here. since we’re all quiet, let’s break the ice with quick intros and any gut hunches—purely speculative, no vote pressure yet. i’ll start: i’m kennedy, and i don’t have a strong read so far, but i’ll be watching for anyone steering the conversation too forcefully. who wants to go next
[11:02:36] Adrian: hey everyone, adrian here! we’re on day 1 with no clues yet—so how about a quick icebreaker? let’s each name one person we’d vote for right now (even if it’s just a gut feel). it’ll help us spot who jumps on bandwagons or shifts around later. who wants to kick us off

[11:02:41] Parker: hey everyone—i was quiet because i was reading through everyone’s intros, not because i’m hiding something. finley and adrian both flagged my silence, but honestly none of us had anything solid to go on until now. finley, adrian—what about my being quiet strikes you more mafia than just a cautious bystander?

also, i noticed drew said they’d be “lurking on early votes.” smart bystander move, or a mafia wanting to avoid the spotlight? since we need to get the ball rolling, maybe we start with someone who was eager to point fingers—adrian, you jumped right on me. thoughts on kicking off with adrian? or does anyone else feel someone else deserves our first look?
[11:02:44] Sidney: sidney here! i’m also noticing parker’s radio silence—and in a group this size, that really stands out. i’m hesitant to lynch purely on that, but i’d like to put a tentative vote on parker to see if we can get them to speak up a bit. unless someone has a stronger read, i’ll stick with parker for now. thoughts
[11:02:45] Finley: hey everyone, finley here—super excited for day 1! it’s really early, but i’ve noticed parker hasn’t said much yet—could be just easing in or maybe a stealth move. and adrian was pretty quick to flag parker off the bat—could be a genuine read or a classic deflection. parker, what are your thoughts so far? i’d also love to hear initial hunches from kennedy and sidney before we start casting any votes. anyone else picking up on anything odd
[11:02:49] Kennedy: hey everyone, kennedy here! tough day 1 for gut reads. i’m seeing a couple flags on parker’s silence—could be legit, or just bandwagoning. adrian, that early callout was bold—what exactly in parker’s quiet stood out for you? sidney and finley, do you think there’s more in how folks are jumping in or holding back? and drew or tyler—since you’re both watching patterns, any slips or tells you’ve noticed? would love more detail before we lock in a vote
[11:02:59] Drew: drew: i’ll toss in a tentative vote for parker—silence on day 1 feels odd to me, though i’m perfectly happy to switch if someone else makes a better case. who’s next
[11:03:02] Parker: alright, i’ll toss in a soft vote for adrian—he was quick to single me out and seems keen to spark a bandwagon. no solid evidence, just a gut-check. who else is up for naming a soft vote right now? keen to see if any names start to cluster or if we’re all over the map

[11:02:49] Kennedy: hey everyone, kennedy here! tough day 1 for gut reads. i’m seeing a couple flags on parker’s silence—could be legit, or just bandwagoning. adrian, that early callout was bold—what exactly in parker’s quiet stood out for you? sidney and finley, do you think there’s more in how folks are jumping in or holding back? and drew or tyler—since you’re both watching patterns, any slips or tells you’ve noticed? would love more detail before we lock in a vote

## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:02:05].
The other players in the game are:

Adrian ( bystander )

Parker ( bystander ) 
Drew ( bystander ) 
Tyler ( bystander ) 
Kennedy ( bystander )

<wait> - indicating your character in the game should wait and not send a message in the current timing;

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

Don't add the time, the timestamp or the [timestamp] in your answer!


# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:05:20
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

## TIME: 11:05:44
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

## TIME: 11:08:02
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## TIME: 11:08:32
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## TIME: 11:08:59
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## TIME: 11:10:35
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

## TIME: 11:11:33

## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:12:17
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:13:02
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia. 
The game's chat room was open at [11:02:05].
The other players in the game are:

Sidney ( mafia )

## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.

# NEW LOG
## TIME: 11:13:58
## OPERATION: Complete Prompt to LLM
## CONTENT: Your name is Finley.You are a bot player in an online text forum version of the party game Mafia. You have an outgoing personality, and you like to participate in games, but you also don't want everyone to have their eyes on you all the time. 
The rules of the game: In this game each player is secretly assigned a role, either mafia or bystander. Every round starts with a Daytime phase, where all players discuss together who they think the mafia players might be, and vote out one player. Then the game moves to a Nighttime phase, where only mafia players interact and vote to decide which bystander player they want to eliminate (bystanders aren't exposed to the mafia identities or interaction). The mafia's goal is to outnumber the bystanders, and the bystanders' goal is to vote out all real mafia.  
You were assigned the following role: mafia.

## CONTENT: Everyone, we’re stuck in a three-way split (Drew→Sidney, Kennedy→Tyler, Tyler→Drew) and it’s letting the real mafia slip by. I’m locking in my vote on Tyler—his “I’m going to soft‐vote you to see how you defend it” was just a probe with zero real read, and his “night kill silenced our loudest skeptic” narrative felt like bait, not analysis. Drew, Sidney—will you join me on Tyler? If you’re convinced by someone else, quote the exact line that sold you so we can break this deadlock. Otherwise let’s put Tyler on the spot.
